    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()
        Specified by:
        getVersion in interface AcrolinxFactory
        Returns:
        the version and the build number of the Java SDK as string in the format "(VERSION) B(BUILDNUMBER)", for example "1.2 B123"

      • createClient

        public AcrolinxClient createClient(ClientInformation clientInformation,
                          ApplicationStore applicationStore)
        Description copied from interface: AcrolinxFactory
        Creates a new AcrolinxClient. The AcrolinxClient holds all client-specific information.
        Note: If you just want to connect to one server you also could use the shortcut AcrolinxFactory.createServerConnection(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore, ConnectionSettings)
        Specified by:
        createClient in interface AcrolinxFactory
        Parameters:
        clientInformation - The ClientInformation: create via AcrolinxFactory.checkInformations()
        applicationStore - The ApplicationStore: create via AcrolinxFactory.applicationStores() or easily implement your own.
        Returns:
        The AcrolinxClient ready for connecting to a server.
        See: AcrolinxClient.lookupServer(ServerEndpointConfiguration) and AcrolinxClient.connect(ConnectionSettings)

      • createServerConnection

        public ServerConnection createServerConnection(ClientInformation clientInformation,
                                      ApplicationStore applicationStore,
                                      ConnectionSettings connectionSettings)
        Description copied from interface: AcrolinxFactory
        Established a ServerConnection. It is some kind of shortcut if you just want to communicate to one server. In other cases you should fist create a AcrolinxClient via AcrolinxFactory.createClient(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore) and connect via AcrolinxClient.connect(ConnectionSettings).
        Specified by:
        createServerConnection in interface AcrolinxFactory
        Parameters:
        clientInformation - The ClientInformation: create via AcrolinxFactory.clientInformations()
        applicationStore - The ApplicationStore: create via AcrolinxFactory.applicationStores() or easily implement your own.
        connectionSettings - The ConnectionSettings: create via AcrolinxFactory.connectionSettings()
        Returns:
        The established ServerConnection to the Acrolinx Server.

      • applicationStores

        public ApplicationStores applicationStores()
        Description copied from interface: AcrolinxFactory
        ApplicationStores are used to store information like authentication tokens. It also could be used to store ConnectionSettings, PluginSettings and CheckSettings.
        Specified by:
        applicationStores in interface AcrolinxFactory
        Returns:
        factory for creating ApplicationStores

        public ServerEndpointConfigurationsFactory serverEndpointConfigurations()
        Description copied from interface: AcrolinxFactory

        Specified by:

      • terminologyQueries

        public TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory terminologyQueries()
        Description copied from interface: AcrolinxFactory
        TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory is used to create a TerminologyQueryBuilder to set parameters for TerminologyQuery which is used to look up terms in the terminology database.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
